ticket.title: RFC-0029 REQ-0004 HTF-bound queue admission and anti-entropy anti-starvation enforcement

tickets.reason: Queue economics admission requires canonical budget profile baseline.
Queue admission depends on deterministic selector/context admissibility checks.

in_scope: Implement lane reservations and tick-floor invariants for stop/revoke and control lanes.
Enforce TP-EIO29-001/002/003 checks in queue and anti-entropy admission paths.
Run adversarial queue drills: replay flood, mixed control/replay bursts, low-rate exhaustion.
Emit structured deny defects for stale, unsigned, missing, or invalid temporal authority envelopes.
out_of_scope: Replay/recovery convergence receipt generation and idempotency closure.

steps: Implement queue scheduler invariants and bounded anti-entropy admission checks.
Bind queue verdicts to signed time_authority_ref and window_ref fields.
Add adversarial stress suites and fail-closed assertion checks.
Capture queue resilience and predicate-verdict evidence artifacts.

criteria: Stop/revoke and control lanes preserve declared tick floors under adversarial load.
Unknown or invalid temporal authority state denies admission.

notes.security: Emergency-time carve-outs must never authorize authority expansion.
notes.verification: Include deterministic anti-starvation and budget-exhaustion deny fixtures.
notes.general: This ticket implements queue and anti-entropy obligations for REQ-0004.
